'Hello, friend. How fare you this day?'

You tell her you are completing the Long List of the Ents, and it names Elves the oldest of all. She smiles gently.

'So, you visited the oldest Elf you knew? Indeed, I have seen much in my long life. There is one yet older than even I who walks upon Middle-earth. Perhaps you will meet him soon.'

'Hello, friend. How fare you this day?'

You tell her you are completing the Long List of the Ents, and it names Elves the oldest of all. She smiles gently.

'So, you visited the oldest Elf you knew? Indeed, I have seen much in my long life. There is one yet older than even I who walks upon Middle-earth. I believe you already know him.'
The bear hungrily eyes the beehive in this tree
The Hobbit children, the laughing-folk, the little people
Completed scavenger hunt card.
The bear hungrily eyes the beehive in this tree
Ent the earthborn, old as mountains

'Well met, fellow explorer! This here before us is named the Endless Stair, carved in the time of Durin himself! It is said to reach from the deepest halls of Khazad-dûm all the way to Durin's Tower, at the peak of Zirakzigil. Aye, it may have once, but in its current state no one can climb that far. Parts of it were destroyed in a great battle! Perhaps one day, when Durin's Folk once again retake Khazad-dûm, we will restore this great stair and the tower on high.'
Boar the fighter

'Hello there, small one. What brings you to the Forest?'

You tell Treebeard about the scavenger hunt, the Long List of the Ents.

'Hoo! You seek all the living creatures? Do not be hasty now, for the list is long and the world is wide! Perhaps I can help.

'Now, how did it go? Hmm hoom.

'Eldest of all, the elf-children. That one is rather easy! Plenty of Elves not far from here in Laurelindórenan, the Golden Wood.

'Dwarf the delver, dark are his houses. Hrum hmm. Somewhere dark and deep you will find the dwarves. Perhaps there are still some in Moria.

'Ent the earthborn, old as mountains. Ah, well you have already found me, clever [placeholder]. Hmm.

'Man the mortal, master of horses. Hmm, the Men that call themselves the Horsemasters live in the land of Rohan. And who is master of the Horsemasters? Hm hmm.

'Beaver the builder. They build themselves homes on the water, but it is always rivers and streams, hmm? Running water?

'Buck the leaper. Hmm,

Every year in the spring, the Anniversary Scavenger Hunt takes place to celebrate a very special occasion.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the current festival ends. </rgb>
Buck the leaper
Defeated Giant ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'Hello there, small one. What brings you to the Forest?'

You tell Treebeard about the scavenger hunt, the Long List of the Ents.

'Hoo! You seek all the living creatures? Do not be hasty now, for the list is long and the world is wide! Perhaps I can help.

'Now, how did it go? Hmm hoom.

'Eldest of all, the elf-children. That one is rather easy! Plenty of Elves not far from here in Laurelindórenan, the Golden Wood.

'Dwarf the delver, dark are his houses. Hrum hmm. Somewhere dark and deep you will find the dwarves. Perhaps there are still some in Moria.

'Ent the earthborn, old as mountains. Ah, well you have already found me, clever [placeholder]. Hmm.

'Man the mortal, master of horses. Hmm, the Men that call themselves the Horsemasters live in the land of Rohan. And who is master of the Horsemasters? Hm hmm.

'Beaver the builder. They build themselves homes on the water, but it is always rivers and streams, hmm? Running water?

'Buck the leaper. Hmm, I have heard stories of the feisty bucks near Imladris. Always in such a hurry! Hoom.

'Bear bee-hunter. Ahh, perhaps in the fields near Iarwain Ben-adar's dwelling? But, be cautious of the evil-hearted one. Hm.

'Boar the fighter. Full of pride and wroth, these creatures. Hmm, perhaps near the Greenway?

'Hound is hungry. Hounds are usually with their masters, Men, hmm! Try where many men gather together to eat.

'Hare is fearful. Fearful of their hunters! But, I hear they are very fond of flowers. Hrum! Yellow flowers,  yes. Hm hmm.

'Eagle in eyrie. Hoom! But you would need wings to reach the Eyrie! Perhaps you can catch a glimpse of one in the Misty Mountains.

'Ox in pasture. Hmm, the Men known as Dunlendings have great herds of oxen.

'Hart horn-crownéd. Hoo! The Silvan Elves have told me of Elks with grand racks of antlers within Eryn Galen.

'Hawk is swiftest. I hear many birds now dwell within the ruins of Eregion. Hoom. It pains me to think of that place.

'Swan the whitest. Hmm hroom. I believe swans can be found in the marshes of the Anduin. Hmm, but was that black swans or white swans?

'Serpent coldest. I have heard that serpents must warm themselves on sun-baked stones. Hm. Perhaps on just the edge of a very cold place.

'The Hobbit children, the laughing-folk, the little people. Ah, they have told me themselves that they dwell in the land called the Shire!

'That is all, small one. Good luck on your travels.'
